articles.Title: The Doors
articles.Actors: Val Kilmer, Meg Ryan, Kyle MacLachlan, Frank Whaley
articles.Plot: The story of the famous and influential 1960s rock band The Doors and its lead singer and composer, Jim Morrison, from his days as a UCLA film student in Los Angeles, to his untimely death in Paris, France at age 27 in 1971.

articles.Title: Jurassic Park
articles.Writer: Michael Crichton (novel), Michael Crichton (screenplay), David Koepp (screenplay)
articles.Actors: Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum, Richard Attenborough
articles.Plot: A pragmatic paleontologist visiting an almost complete theme park is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

articles.Title: Jurassic World
articles.Writer: Rick Jaffa (screenplay by), Amanda Silver (screenplay by), Colin Trevorrow (screenplay by), Derek Connolly (screenplay by), Rick Jaffa (story by), Amanda Silver (story by), Michael Crichton (based on the characters created by)
articles.Actors: Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Irrfan Khan, Vincent D'Onofrio
articles.Plot: A new theme park, built on the original site of Jurassic Park, creates a genetically modified hybrid dinosaur, the Indominus Rex, which escapes containment and goes on a killing spree.

articles.Title: Braveheart
articles.Actors: James Robinson, Sean Lawlor, Sandy Nelson, James Cosmo
articles.Plot: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.
articles.Language: English, French, Latin, Scottish Gaelic, Italian

articles.Title: The Shawshank Redemption
articles.Writer: Stephen King (short story "Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption"), Frank Darabont (screenplay)
articles.Actors: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler
articles.Plot: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.
articles.Awards: Nominated for 7 Oscars. Another 21 wins & 36 nominations.

articles.Title: The Green Mile
articles.Actors: Tom Hanks, David Morse, Bonnie Hunt, Michael Clarke Duncan
articles.Plot: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift.
articles.Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 15 wins & 33 nominations.

articles.Title: Misery
articles.Actors: James Caan, Kathy Bates, Richard Farnsworth, Frances Sternhagen
articles.Plot: After a famous author is rescued from a car crash by a fan of his novels, he comes to realize that the care he is receiving is only the beginning of a nightmare of captivity and abuse.
